intro: Leptochloa mucronata, commonly known as the narrowleaf grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a low-growing perennial grass characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Leptochloa mucronata is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its drought tolerance and soil stabilization abilities.
